channel.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
channel.description:
This was for my class project. I want you guys to ignore the content and concentrate on the layout. How do you like it? How can I make it better? I noticed that when viewing the webpage on IE the border under the current tab is the same border color as the content box. Is there a way I can fix this? Do I need to use IE conditionals? and how do you like the navigation?
By the way, I know the logo sucks. Is there a way in Gimp to make the background transparent and have the image blur itself to the transparent background?
Thanks for the input. Hope to hear some constructive criticism. :)
[url=http://pubpages.unh.edu/~rpv25/final/clientpull.html]Website[/url]

item.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I need to read up on liquid design. I tried to make one where I wanted the left or right column to stay at a certain fixed width while the content and header would be a percentage. I never got it to work correctly but I’ll give it another try.

la­wl:

dont use jpg u dumb fagets

The pictures were rushed. I wish I looked for transparent gifs and made margins around the images but I finished the website on an all-nighter. So I suppose it could have been better. The real .com website that will be finished (eventually) will be heavily worked on.

and has anyone know the fix for the IE border problem I’m having? I tried googling but no luck. I hope somebody figures it out because I really hate registering for another website just to post… so annoying.

Read full topic

try designing for 1024px since that’s what most users are using these days or you could try using a fully liquid design, but its nice dude i like it keep up the good work buddy, glad to see you around here again

item.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

@mwiebelhaus, yep. I think the URL gave it away.

@FastBawls, yeah that’s true, but where would you like to see those changes the most? I will definitely add that code to the page. I knew I needed to use it but I was so tired after my all-nighter, that I had to take a break.

@jme, yeah I didn’t know how to show that page without making the header logo appear strangely. Any suggestions for that?

@OnlyOneRule, We weren’t allowed to touch the code at the bottom of each page. That was the professor’s code to check if our pages validated and when we last edited it so she can check if we passed it in on time.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

  1. More color variety, and better colors.
  2. Another font besides times new roman :3

that’s pretty much it.

P.S.: On the characters page, add a p img { margin: 20px; } and p { text-align:justify }

Read full topic
item.source: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created

item.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:249946”]Thanks for the fast responses!

@cumescape, thanks, but which color is off? The border, background, tabs, text?

@RXVL, yeah I have been quite busy at college. Still messing around with code though haha. Yeah I need better pictures for all the characters on the characters page (except for Kenny, he looks perfect!).

@RXVL and mwiebelhaus. Hmm this may be hard to explain. I meant having the picture’s edges blurred and putting that on a trasparent background so that the image looks as if it blurs into the background color (whatever the background color may be). But most browsers do not support transparent pngs and transparent jpgs are impossible… and gifs do not support enough colors.

@mwiebelhaus, wow that is an awesome picture! Thank you very much. I will definitely add that to the page. Right now the webpage is being graded by the teacher so I am not allowed to touch it until she has posted the grades.

If there is anything else I could do, please let me know. I’m planning on launching a very unique website soon. Hopefully then I will have enough money to go on my road trip this christmas break! :D[/quote]

let me guess you got to the university of new Hampshire?

Read full topic
item.source: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created

item.title: Rate my website, that I, myself, have created
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Thanks for the fast responses!

@cumescape, thanks, but which color is off? The border, background, tabs, text?

@RXVL, yeah I have been quite busy at college. Still messing around with code though haha. Yeah I need better pictures for all the characters on the characters page (except for Kenny, he looks perfect!).

@RXVL and mwiebelhaus. Hmm this may be hard to explain. I meant having the picture’s edges blurred and putting that on a trasparent background so that the image looks as if it blurs into the background color (whatever the background color may be). But most browsers do not support transparent pngs and transparent jpgs are impossible… and gifs do not support enough colors.

@mwiebelhaus, wow that is an awesome picture! Thank you very much. I will definitely add that to the page. Right now the webpage is being graded by the teacher so I am not allowed to touch it until she has posted the grades.

If there is anything else I could do, please let me know. I’m planning on launching a very unique website soon. Hopefully then I will have enough money to go on my road trip this christmas break!

Read full topic

Can you explain this more?[/quote]

Do you mean as in like opacity?

Anyway it looks good except for the top I think the title needs to be bigger.

I’ve made you a header for the page. Whether you choose to use it or not doesn’t matter to me
